issues.description: The stack-based recursion protection might not handle all circular references in complex PDFs, potentially causing infinite recursion
Recursive call to clean_forms with growing stack parameter could lead to memory issues with deeply nested forms
Casting to DictionaryObject without checking if elt['/Resources'] exists could cause null pointer dereference
Broad exception handling (TypeError, KeyError) silently ignores errors that might indicate deeper problems
Direct modification of self._objects without proper cleanup could lead to resource leaks
Casting to_delete to ObjectDeletionFlag without proper validation could cause type errors
Using cast(ContentStream, content) assumes content is always a ContentStream, which might not be true in all cases
No check if elt is a StreamObject before accessing its properties could lead to attribute errors
